alert.note: Alert for Cecil (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:55PM EST until January 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Cecil County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Wednesday, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, additional roadways near the tidal portions of the Elk River, Bohemia River, Back Creek, and other tidal tributaries begin to flood. Some damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. At 6.0 feet, widespread shoreline inundation occurs near Charlestown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 6 feet above normal. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 8:57 PM and 8:50 AM. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 8:29 PM and 8:22 AM. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 8:57 PM and 9:26 AM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
